subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: The Columbus Blue Jackets re-signed the restricted free agent goalie Pascal Leclaire to a three-year contract through the 2010-11 season. Leclaire, 25, is coming off his best season, going 24-17-6 with a 2.25 goals-against average, .919 save percentage and nine shutouts in 54 games. He ranked second in the N.H.L. in shutouts, seventh in goals-against average and 11th in save percentage. Leclaire has the best record in franchise history, and his shutout total nearly doubled the previous club mark five set by Marc Denis in 2002-03.
